The exact position Grimm stone is only a few rulers and the chief priests Caeras known the occupants of the Grimm guards - a secret guild of warriors and Judicator that roam through the lands around the Innersee -. Brought here for many generations.

Only those who should ever reach the exit of the prison, would regain his freedom. So far, however, this is no one company.

Mega Grim - The Secrets of Kar'Zagoth
Slowly it escalates - a whopping 25 pages Stefan Bushuvens Mega Dungeon includes Grimmenstein since the most recent update of the secrets of Kar'Zagoth :
The orc city Kar'Zagoth waiting for the prisoners of Grimmenstein. in the different levels of the city to explore the characters including the Orcish Mines, the slave quarters Dul'Zagoth that cursed place of sacrifice and the caves of the Dragon Kargoth Suophor who can oppose them as an ally, clients or opponents. contains some enhancements to existing secondary level and 14 quests in and around around the Kar'zagoth new package an overview of the powers and entities under Grimmenstein: Of the Orcs on the stone elves and Grimm dwarfs up to the people of Deepholm and the Guardians of the depth as well as other powers groupings, open up a whirlwind of intrigue and diplomacy for the players. addition Four new treasure maps added to an existing set, here are among the first parts of Xoth's mantle, a mighty Setgegenstand lost in the dungeons of the black mage ..

131190.name: The Book of Principles
131190.description:
User summary:

A collection of the various scripts available for use for the Industry, Security, Unity, Simplicity, Truth, Innovation and Empire Principles.

131191.name: Melee Weapon Rulebook
131191.description:
From Introduction:

Welcome to 'Beyond the Ӕther! If you haven’t already, please download and read the Beyond the Ӕther Main Rulebook, available from our website.

If you’re reading this, you’ve likely decided to play a character who uses melee weapons. Whether a simple dagger, an elaborate rapier, or a brutal greatsword, you will be fighting your enemies up close and personal. To do so safely, we’ve created the following guide.

131192.name: Trivial Pursuit Lifestyle Reise edition
131192.description:
This is a standalone, travel-sized German Trivial Pursuit, based on the theme of 'Lifestyle'.

This is a two-player (or two teams) game, with simplified Trivial Pursuit rules.
By rolling the dice and picking up a colour, each person can answer the relevant question and win (or not) the coloured section to be inserted in a slot.

The winner is the person (or team) who completes all colours in the slots.

131193.name: Week 1
131193.description:
From publisher blurb:

It's been three weeks since the birth of Faith Carlson. The group has remained at the Barrow farm while both the mother and child recover enough to travel.

With hundreds of miles remaining to reach Colorado, and supplies limited, the characters have been raiding nearby rural towns in preparation. Ambushed by men within the town, their problems are quickly increased when they realize that new Living Dead wandering into the area are actually from Sanctuary . . . and that Edward Russo and his army of millions of zombies are on their trail!

131194.name: This is a Dark Ride
131194.description:
From publisher blurb:

This is A Dark Ride is a sourcebook detailing the world's most famous amusement park as it exists in the In Dark Alleys modern-day-horror setting. Included is in-depth info on the mundane park, various supernatural entities, NPCs and groups, guidelines for creating a park employee character and a complete adventure.

131195.name: In Dark Alleys: Little Boy Lost
131195.description:
From publisher blurb:

In Dark Alleys: Little Boy Lost was created for Free RPG Day. It is a quick-start adventure for In Dark Alleys, the game of cosmological and psychological horror. Rather that playing people with supernatural knowledge and abilities (as in regular In Dark Alleys), in Little Boy Lost the players play regular college students, who must find a missing boy who has found a way into a strange and terrible place. Little Boy Lost contains a simplified version of the Organic Rules Components (ORC) game system from In Dark Alleys, 6 pre-generated characters and a complete adventure.

131196.name: Random Generator as a Dungeon Map Poster
131196.description:
From the "Blog of Holding" website:

This intricately illustrated 36" by 24" playable dungeon map poster encapsulates the 1E Dungeon Masters Guide complete rules for generating random dungeons; Appendix A's four pages of charts are rendered into a flowchart WHICH IS ITSELF A DUNGEON. It's like the Platonic dungeon: from it, all other dungeons may be generated. Or maybe it's the Dungeon of Ouroboros. Or maybe it's D&D's missing game board.

131197.name: Napoleonic Scenarios Volume 5: Wellington's Victories
131197.description:
From back cover:

"Volume 5 presents eleven historical scenarios that follow Wellington's famous Peninsular victories from Vimiero in 1808 until the final victory at Toulouse in 1814.

All are designed for use with General de Brigade Napoleonic wargames rules, (but may be converted to any similar system). Each scenario provides palayers with terrain maps, troop deployments, objectives and orders of battle. Several of the scenarios are linked and cam be played as part of a mini-campaign or, as in the case of the Vimiero or Busaco scenarios, combined to fight one large action.

Wellington's Victories

Vimiero 1808 - Vimiero Hill
Vimiero 1808 - Action at Ventosa
Talavera 1809 - Battle for the Medellin
Talavera 1809 - Battle for the Redoubt
Busaco 1810 - Reynier's Assault
Busaco 1810 - Ney's Assault
Salamanca 1812 - Clausel's Counter-Attack
Salamanca 1812 - The French Rearguard
Vittoria 1813 - The Hill of Arinex
Sorauren 1813 - Cole's Ridge
Toulouse 1814 - Final Victory

131198.description:
From the Publisher's website***




Block War is the first supplement for the Judge Dredd miniatures game, adding new forces and new rules for the latest wave of Mega-City One models.
Inside you will find rules for bringing vehicles to the tabletop, for waging huge riots, invasions, and block wars, as well as new forces such as the Brit-Cit Justice Department and Citi-Def squads - all guaranteed to bring mayhem to your games!
We are constantly updating Block War, and it will always be available as a free download, allowing you to dive straight in and start playing. All forces and new rules build upon the campaign system presented in the core rulebook, allowing you to expand your games to the furthest reaches of the comic strip, past the walls of Mega-City One and into the world beyond.
May your Lawgiver always fire true!
131198.name: Judge Dredd Miniatures Game: Block War
boardgameexpansion: Judge Dredd Miniatures Game: Blood on the Streets

131199.description:
Soluna is a simple and fast-playing brain teaser for two players.

The game consists of twelve double-sided discs; each disc has one of four space-themed symbols (sun, stars, moon, comet) on one side and a different symbol on the other side. At the start of play, the tiles are scattered on the table, creating twelve stacks that are each one tile high. On a turn, you take one stack and place it on another stack that is either (a) the same height or (b) topped by a tile with the same symbol. Stacks cannot be divided. Players take turns until one player cannot make a move; that player loses the game and the other player wins.

Soluna is nearly identical to the earlier Bruno Faidutti game Babylon, but the double-sided discs create a new starting set-up for each round. The first player to win four rounds wins the game.

Reimplements


Babylon
131199.name: Soluna

131200.description:
Quarantine Z is a survival card game for 3-5 players. It takes place in a town, city or neighborhood that has been infested with a Zombie outbreak. The Department of Inexplicable Events has placed the area under quarantine; nothing can get out of the area until the zombie threat runs its course. One player plays as the Zombies, whose goal is to kill all Survivors. The remaining Players are Survivors, whose goal is to collect supplies and find shelter to outlast the zombie threat and the quarantine.

Survivors win if they are still alive when the Zombie Player runs out of cards in the Zombie Deck, and the Zombie Player's hand is empty. Each Survivor has 3 life, and they can be hurt by either Zombies, or other Survivors. By playing Supply cards while they are at a Shelter, Survivors "wait a week" and the Zombie player is forced to discard cards.

Survivors travel from location to location collecting Supplies and Munitions and killing or evading zombies placed in their path by the Zombie player. They must also watch out for the other Survivors who may at any time, betray them to steal their food and supplies, or use them as a distraction to save themselves.
131200.name: Quarantine Z

131201.name: Week 2
131201.description:
From publisher blurb:

After rescuing their allies from an ambush set by Edward Russo's Living Dead, the group made it back on the road and headed toward Colorado.

Delayed yet again by a trap that disabled the vehicles, the convoy is now assaulted by a clan of cannibals that have escaped into a nearby series of caverns. Forced to rescue several kidnapped allies, the characters must play a game of survival in unfamiliar and dangerous territory.

131202.name: Week 4
131202.description:
From publisher blurb:

The convoy must fight for its life against the combined might of the Ragers and the few Living Dead not yet frozen by the early winter. Escaping and finding shelter from the heavy snow in a nearby cavern, the characters are soon attacked in renewed force.

Left with little choice if they are to stay alive, they head deeper and deeper into the treacherous depths of the cave system, eventually discovering an opening at the other end. Left now with no vehicles or supplies, in the stark cold of heavy snowfall, it becomes clear that if the creatures do not kill them soon, the weather will finish the job.

131203.name: Week 3
131203.description:
From publisher blurb:

After a pitched battle that saw several women and children carried off into the night by cannibals, the convoy had to split into separate teams. One team tracked the cannibals down to their hidden cabin and staged a daring rescue; another team went into the city in search of tires to fit the RV and Humvees.

Finally arriving in Colorado, the characters are faced with a new set of problems. Will they be able to keep everything together, while at the same time facing the bitter cold and heavy snowfall?

131204.name: Week 5
131204.description:
From publisher blurb:

In Chapter Three: Week Five, the group must place their lives in the hands of the men as the Ragers catch up to them. It doesn't take long for them to realize that the men are outlaws, and that the women in the convoy are in danger.

Forced with no choice but to fight or die, the characters initiate a chain of events that will see the return of an enemy from the first weeks of the Outbreak- the man called Hell Fuerrie!

131205.name: Week 6
131205.description:
From publisher blurb:

After taking control of the Federal Prison from the outlaws, the characters and the other survivors must now work to build a new home.

When a strange, new mystery presents itself, however, will the survivors have what it takes to discover the truth before it is too late?

131206.name: Week 7
131206.description:
From publisher blurb:

Arriving to find the Citizen Relocation Zone in ruins thanks to a combined outbreak of Living Dead and Ragers, the convoy barely managed to escape by discovering a prison controlled by a band of outlaws and raiders. After managing to overthrow the occupants, they've now obtained a place of safety and security.

Or have they?

After discovering a hidden door leading into an underground laboratory, can the characters discover the secrets of the Federal prison before the entire survivor camp is torn apart?

131207.name: Week 8
131207.description:
From publisher blurb:

With deepening mysteries circling above their heads, the characters have also discovered the problems of leading a large group of people. Already, a gunshot tragedy has seen three people in the infirmary, and another locked away in a cell. Families that existed since before the outbreak become further unraveled, and the characters are going to have to find a way to hold it all together if they hope to survive.

Even as the characters attempt to carve order out of the growing chaos, an old enemy comes knocking at the gates. Hell Fuerrie wants control of the prison back, and he's prepared to raze it to the ground if he can't have it.

131208.name: Week 9
131208.description:
From publisher blurb:

Winter has struck, and although the Living Dead have been frozen stiff, problems for the characters are far from over.

The prison has become a nest of trouble. Conflicts within the survivor camp have left three people under medical care, and another behind bars. Suspicions between survivors are mounting, and it might only be a matter of time before the situations explode into chaos.

Meanwhile, things continue to fall apart within the prison as a killer is on the loose.

131209.name: Week 10
131209.description:
From publisher blurb:

Although the Living Dead are frozen and immobile in the harsh, wintry weather, the characters are faced with an entirely new set of problems.

Left with more questions than answers, and with time seemingly working against them, the characters have their hands full not only defending the prison against external enemies, but in securing the survivor camp against internal threats.

Now, the characters must deal with the aftermath of Kyle Elliot's murder as they work to uncover the identity of the guilty party. Meanwhile, lines are clearly drawn in the sand as the survivors begin forming factions of their own- a move that could tear the camp apart, and get more people killed.

131210.name: Week 11
131210.description:
From publisher blurb:

While leading a group of diverse people is never easy, leading a group of people assembled through a sheer need for survival in a world controlled by the Living Dead is extremely dangerous.

Over the past several months, the characters have faced hordes of Living Dead, watched allies die, and discovered a bestial species with greater-than-human strength and endurance. Along the way, they have managed to avoid starvation, betrayal, and traps meant to maim or kill them. None of that, however, has prepared them for what they now face.

A revelation that will rip the prison down from the inside out.

131211.name: Week 12
131211.description:
From publisher blurb:

As Shakespeare once wrote: "Uneasy lies the head that wears a crown." For the characters, that quote has probably never ringed truer.

The characters are drawn into a war against the militia that ends in several tragic deaths. An outbreak of the Living Dead infests the prison, and another murder is committed.

It all comes to a head for the characters when they learn the truth about the prison- and the truth about the real killer.

131212.name: Week 13
131212.description:
From publisher blurb:

They say that every end is a new beginning. If that is true, then life for the characters is about to jump cycles.

As War of the Dead: Chapter Three comes to a close, the characters must contend with more upheaval within the camp as the militia hunts the murderer. Friends make plans to leave, and the very future of the camp is cast into doubt. Meanwhile, commandos from the Federal base at Groom Lake, Nevada arrive not only to claim the facility, but to also take the camp into custody.

All of that pales in comparison to the full-scale assault Hell Fuerrie leads against the prison- and the arrival of an army of Ragers within the very walls.

131213.description:
Perilous Pyramids is a competitive multiplayer card game in which players assume the roles of archeologists each racing to the center chamber of a pyramid.

Each player builds their own side of the pyramid using ten face-down chamber cards. Players clear chambers by playing resource cards from their hand that meet or exceed the difficulty of the chamber.

These same resource cards can be used to make the opponents' chambers even harder to overcome, swap revealed chamber cards, cancel a played card and more.

The first player to clear their pyramid completely and clear the final central chamber wins the game.

Game-play is fast and aggressive, as the game encourages players to sabotage the efforts of their opponents.
131213.name: Perilous Pyramids

131214.name: Tumble Down
131214.description:
User Summary

Tumble down is a game of patience and careful balance, in the mode of Jenga. Players take turn removing blocks from the tower and relocating them onto the top to create a more treacherous play area with each turn.

131218.name: The Island
131218.description:
From the introduction:
"Mr. Noble knows one of you has it. Any information leading to its return will be handsomely rewarded. I'll see you in one hour. I hope you have the right answer for me."

From the author:
"inspired by the TV show The Prisoner, as well as Lost"

User Summary:
The Island is a re-theming of the minimalist game skeleton, Ghost/Echo.

The principle resolution mechanism is to roll 1d6 for each danger and for each goal, then to assign results. 65/43/21 = good/mixed/bad outcomes.

131219.name: Hidden Fires
131219.description:
Party game. 14 attractive cards are placed around the room and up to 14 guests are invited to guess the answers to the 14 clue cards. All answers must include the word or phrase that include the word Fire or Fires in it. The clues range from easy to downright impossible (Example: Clue - Unsportsmanlike Incendiarism? Answer - Backfire). See what I mean?

At the host's call, the competition stops and the guest with the most correct answers, wins.

boardgameimplementation: MindMaze: Verzwickte Rätsel – Geld, Ruhm und Macht
131221.description:
In Mind Maze players will be told a story and must figure out why and how the story happened by asking questions that can be answered with "Yes" or "No". The person telling the story can also choose to answer with “Not Important” if players start getting too far off track.

Mind Maze allows players to test their skills of deduction and investigation, and to get to the bottom of the mystery with as few questions as possible. Players take turns asking questions, and lose a point for every question they ask. Points can be gained by asking specific key questions which also help players to figure out the true version of the story. This encourages players to think carefully about the questions they ask and to work together.
131221.name: MindMaze

131222.name: Abracadabra
131222.description:
Abracadabra (Who are you? A creative liar or a walking encyclopedia?) is a party game based on the game Dictionary. Here’s how it works: pick a card from the deck, see the word on it and read it out loud. This word is most likely UNKNOWN to you but painfully SIMILAR to a word that you most likely do know.
Your task is to summon your deepest knowledge or, even better, your acting skills, and convince the other players that you know exactly what the word means.

What is an Enchiridion? A collapsible folder? A Mexican food? A rare-earth metal? Do you have your own version?

There is only one word, but everyone will have their own interpretation of what it means. You have to convince everyone that YOUR definition of the word is correct. The key to Abracadabra lies in a player’s ability to improvise the definitions and persuade all the other players that you really do know what you're talking about. Players earn points by convincing other players that their definition is correct, or at least close to correct, by betting on the most accurate definitions and by actually getting the definition right.

131223.name: Millennium Gravitas TCG
131223.description:
Millennium Gravitas is a tactical science-fiction cardgame of eXploration, eXpansion, eXploitation, and eXtermination (4X). The game features Invasion and Colonization of Planets, Technology Research, Tactical Space-combat, Ship Construction and Customization, Anomalies and Resource Management.

Gameplay consists of building structures (ex. energy collectors) to gather resources, colonize planets to man your spaceships and research technology to equip your fleet, planets and shipyard.

This is accomplished by drawing cards from your deck and playing them according to various rules and time-based mechanics (building ships takes time for example).

The goal of the game is to defeat the opposing player according to three different victory-conditions:

Extinction - The opposing player loses all Population (by invasion or destruction of planets or structures)

Starvation - The opposing player loses all Energy (by stealing energy or destroying collectors)

Burnout - The opposing player loses the ability to play Units (by losing all cards in his main deck and hand)

Millennium Gravitas relies less on luck-of-the-draw than other comparable games and gives the player more control over their strategy. The core mechanics are focused on flexibility and tactics rather than deck-building or owning the most powerful cards to overpower your opponent.

The game supports different game-modes, like 1vs1, 2vs2 or +4vs (the mechanics theoretically do not limit the amount of players that are able to play together or against each other). All complex play styles are supported, from team-matches to last-man-standing. This creates many interesting games with temporary alliances and even politics as emergent game-play. Additionally Millennium does not require a game-board or sophisticated game-pieces and miniatures, all you need to play is knowledge of the rules, your own deck, and something to be used as tokens.

131224.description:
At the 2012 Essen Spiel, the following 5 promo cards will be given to customers that pre-order Uchronia:


Nursery
Ranch
Canal
Pterodrome
Embassy


The Uchronia Promo Cards are a set of 5 cards to be added to those in the Uchronia base game. They are simply shuffled in with the other building cards, adding more variety from game to game.
131224.name: Uchronia Promo Cards

131225.name: Age of Ruin
rpgseries: EPIC - Living Forgotten Realms Epic Campaign Adventures
131225.description:
From the first page of the PDF:

Catastrophic events have transpired during your absence, and Faerûn lies in ruins. In a world covered in darkness that even the gods have forsaken, can you provide a shred of hope to the few survivors, or will you too succumb to despair? A three-round Living Forgotten Realms Epic Campaign adventure for 25th level characters. This adventure is a direct sequel to EPIC4-1 Shooting the Moon.

This is a three-round adventure. We recommend that you allow a minimum of 12-15 hours of playing time.

131226.name: Tactical Conflict
131226.description:
Tactical Conflict is an tactical wargame. It's played on a hex boardgame with different futuristic units and cards. With its simple rules, the game is easy to learn and fast to play.

Two players face each other on a 8x18 hexes battlefield. Before the game begins each player chooses cards and buys an army of different units up to a fixed amount of money. The players start on the opposite side of the battlefield. Each player got three actions per turn, where he can command his units or play a card, which affects units or the battlefield itself. There are different hex types like swamp, street, bridge or forest. Some objects like buildings, cliffs and rocks may block the line of sight or can't be entered. Every unit has its special ability, like shooting through buildings for example, or climbing up rocks. Some other objects may give you protection and a hideout. The player who defeats all opposing units wins the game.

131227.name: Flex' Tour
131227.description:
Object of the Game is to build tower with 6 floors.

In his turn player removes a column from the tower and places it a higher floor. As soon as 10 columns are placed new floor begins. The color of the column player must to remove and place is indicated by the dice.

If a player is clumsy and the tower collapses player is removed from the game. last player in game is the winner.

131228.name: Tower of Dark Sorcery
131228.description:
From the introduction:
Wilma the Witch has developed a cure for the Purple Plague. She'll give it to the party... if they retrieve a book from an ancient wizard's tower.

131229.name: CryptidsTV 2
131229.description:
User summary

A stand-alone expansion to Cryptids TV. Contains more (biligual Japanese/English) monster description cards and more headlines, notepads and cards necessary to play the game. Timer and pen is not included.

Cryptids TV is a party game where players draw imaginary creatures
based on a short description and a newspaper headline, and then, on a timer, present each other's creations as if they were show hosts on a TV show.

Can be combined with the material in CryptidsTV.

131230.name: Trollmaster
131230.description:
User summary
An action selection game with a witch theme and the quirky mechanism that the total number of resources in every player's hands must be enough for you to perform your selected action. The more advanced actions are performed first, so players must try make educated guesses on what resources the other players have.

Actions include to collect mana, summon monsters (which will give you special powers), attack other players (to get points) or simply collect points, among others. What monsters are available for summon varies for each game.

Game ends as soon as any one player has reached 20 points, at which point the player with the most points wins.

131231.name: When Good Games Go Bad
rpgsetting: New Khazan: Adventure in the Nine Thousand Worlds
131231.description:
Publisher blurb (edited to clarify ruleset required):

From the author of Gamesmen of Kasar, this solo adventure is set on the planet Bollux IV in the same fun but lethal spirit as that classic adventure.

This is a solitaire adventure for a single 3rd-, 4th-, or 5th-level character created from the rules of Tom Loney’s New Khazan or Ken St. Andre’s Tunnels & Trolls. You will need one or both sets of rules to understand and play the game. Warriors, Rogues, or Wizards may play, but magic users may find their spell-casting ability severely limited in some parts of the Game complex.

131232.description:
Bloody hands strangle the city. Beneath the illusion of sophistication there is ever a savage fight for power. As always, the law serves the greedy, corrupt politicians favor the most persuasive, and the local police and feds alike share the profits like so much sweet cake.

As the head of your Mafia family in Mafia City, you struggle for control of the city against others like yourself. Each part of the city plays a role in your plans. Actions must be swift and merciless. Underestimate no one. One wrong move is unforgiveable.

Through a shadowy hitman you instill fear – but around that iron fist, a velvet glove. You must dance the social dance, pulling strings among the elite. Dance well and you'll be well placed to execute your plans with ruthless precision...

...this city will be yours!

The goal of Mafia City is to be the first player to gain a certain number of victory points – that is, proof of your power over the city. Victory points are gained only by controlling locations (i.e., parts of the city). As the head of a mafia clan, each player fights for control over locations by sending his Mafiosi into locations, playing his action cards effectively, using the effects of locations under the players control, and using special characters that appear in the game to his advantage.
131232.name: Mafia City

131233.name: The Cobbler and the Elves
131233.description: The object of this game is to move around the playing board according to the numbers scored on the spinner and to accumulate as many game cards as possible. The first player to accumulate 30 game cards is the winner.

131234.name: Pocket Minions
131234.description:
One day, a group of hapless minions wandered into a beautiful valley and built a castle, only to find that their construction work had angered the ferocious fire-breathing dragons that lived there.

It’s up to YOU - the Almighty Finger - to save them from being burned to a crisp by those angry dragons.

FEATURES

Play through 10 levels to lead your minions safely to the *LEGENDARY TREASURE!
Build your medieval castle from the ground up and watch as your tiny minions move in and go about their business
Tap to collect the resources that your minions produce
Manage your tower well to maximize your minion’s productivity - make sure the furnaces are hot, toilets clean and fresh smelling to keep your minions from rioting. Angry minions will turn into thieves and steal your stuff!
Recruit minions with special abilities to help you catch thieves or exorcise ghosts
Defend your castle from dragon attacks!
Physics sim lets you flick and toss your minions
Universal app supports retina displays on both iPhone, iPod Touch and iPad
Who is the Mightiest Finger of all? Check your score and ranking in GameCenter!




Source: The Game Website.

131235.name: Babel Rising 3D
131235.description:
Babel Rising puts you in the sacred sandals of the great and angry Almighty God. Bring to bear scorching and wrathful powers to smite arrogant humans and prevent them from building the tower of Babel. You shall hurl bolts of holy lightning, summon punishing earthquakes, and unleash vengeful floods upon the foolish and irreverent Humans.

This sequel to the successful and critically acclaimed iPhone game adds something new to its original gameplay. Thanks to 3D, Divine powers are now even more spectacular, allowing the player to enjoy an epic peplum experience.

KEY FEATURES

Destroy the Defiant Idols of Human Vanity Prevent humans from building towers of Babel at various times in history. Discover an exciting 15 mission, single-player campaign. Improve your Godly stamina in Babel Rising’s patented survival mode.

Only a God can rise to the challenge! Express your wrath against diligent workers led and strengthened by:

Protective Priests who shield workers from your spells.
Sacred Urn Porters who increase the cool-down times of your powers.
Siege Towers that help humans to access upper levels faster.




Cargo Ships bringing stones to the yard.

Manage your powers wisely to eliminate successive waves of enemies!

Control the Elements Access twice as many powers as in the original game. Discover ultimate elemental attacks based on fire, water, earth and air, each with its unique effect depending on the target: the Rolling Stone, Sirocco, Meteorite Shower and many more.

Expand the Experience Gained for excellent performance and in-app purchases, you’ll collect Babel currency. Use it to buy scrolls, passive powers and levels to improve your skills and your gaming experience.

Source: The Game Website.

131236.name: Rayman Jungle Run
videogamehonor: 2013 D.I.C.E. Casual Game of the Year Nominee
2013 D.I.C.E. Cellular/Mobile Game of the Year Nominee
131236.description:
The legendary platforming hero is making the jump to your favorite iOS device! Rayman Jungle Run is powered by the same UbiArt Framework engine that brought you Rayman Origins - Winner of numerous Game of the Year and Platformer of the Year awards.

KEY FEATURES

- Beautiful graphics supported by Retina Display
- New worlds to discover
- New powers to unlock
- Captivating music
- Smooth touch-based controls
- Exclusive wallpapers to unlock for your device
- Multiple Cloud saves support
- GameCenter Leaderboards

Rayman Jungle Run is easy for all ages to pick up and play, but challenging for the longtime Rayman fans to master. Unlock the Land of the Livid Dead levels if you have the skills!

Source: The Publisher Website.

131238.name: Battle of the Youstrass
131238.description:
User Summary

Battle of the Youstrass is a fantasy themed turn based strategy game featuring mecha, comparable to the super robot wars franchise.

It was published and developed by Team Darkland in 2001.

131239.description:
Fanticide is a whimsically grim skirmish game for battles between opposing homicidal warbands. Open Architecture and clear guidelines for building any kind of war band you want with figures you want to use. Ruleset is friendly to any miniatures, including historicals. Starting bands include centaurs, fae, creeps, and the flying monkeys from the Land of Od. Does not use an “I go, you go” turn sequence. Instead, it uses a card driven sequence, full of events and interesting command & control choices for determining what units can move and act. These cards are assigned to each unit, character and monster in the game. These activation cards are drawn one at a time and the units are activated in turn. There are also Event cards that are shuffled in with the activation cards which produce random outcomes like killer unicorns enraged by the ‘Rainbow’ Event. Easy to learn but challenges and rewards intelligent game play. 30 to 40 figures per side is typical. D10 Combat and magic is simple but gives an interactive and satisfying result.
Sculpting by Mike Broadbent, Alan Marsh, Paul Clarke, and Ernest Baker
131239.name: Fanticide
boardgamepodcastepisode: D6G Ep 113: Fanticide Interview & Zombicide Detailed Review

131240.name: Civilization: The New World
131240.description:
This is a standalone variant for Civilization. Its rules are based on Advanced Civilization more than the original Civilization. Included are more civilization advancements (both quantity and type), which give the players new options for advancement, as well as a slightly restructured commodity trading round, which has new resources and disasters to be traded.
Included in the complete package is a new map, different cultures, new trade cards and calamities, a new AST board for the cultures, and a few new advances.
This does not require the original game to play as everything for it comes in a new package for you to Print and Play.
Variant Designed by Martin DeOlden, User Tawnos76

131241.description:
Texas, 1933 — a new day dawns for the brave pioneers of the American West, like yourself. Under the burning sand, the black gold awaits for your arrival, so what are you waiting for? Get a government lease in one of the richest oil reservoirs, build towers, drill the resources, trade and invest wisely! Only the most audacious amongst you, using a smart strategy, will be able to surpass your competitors and become a true oil tycoon.

In Oilfield, you take the role of an American businessman striving for wealth in the early 1930s, who will try to exploit the rich reservoirs in Texas, trading with natural gas and oil in the most profitable markets. Naturally, you will not be alone as other risky entrepreneurs like yourself will try to obtain riches and wealth with their own investments.

The goal of the game is to be the player with the largest number of investments (victory points) at the end of the game. You can perform two actions each round of the game: a public action and a secret action. The number of VP you acquire during the game depends on how wisely you manage these actions.

•••

Texas, 1933, un nuevo día amanece para los intrépidos pioneros del oeste americano como tú.
Bajo las ardientes arenas del desierto, el oro negro espera pacientemente tu llegada... ¿a qué esperas?
¡Consigue una concesión del gobierno en alguna de las zonas de extracción más ricas, construye torres, extrae el petróleo, comercia e invierte con cabeza!
Sólo siendo el más audaz en los negocios y con una inteligente estrategia conseguirás superar a tus competidores y convertirte en un auténtico magnate del petróleo en Oilfield.
RESUMEN:
En Oilfield, te meterás en la piel de un hombre de negocios de la América de los años 30 que, ávido de riquezas, tratará de explotar los ricos yacimientos de Texas y comercializar el gas y el petróleo de la forma más rentable posible.
Por supuesto, no estás solo, otros arriesgados emprendedores tratarán de obtener a la vez que tú, la mayor rentabilidad de sus inversiones.
El objetivo es ser el jugador con el mayor número de inversiones (PV) al final de la partida.
Tendrás la oportunidad de realizar 2 acciones en cada ronda de juego, una pública y otra privada.
Estas acciones incluyen la obtención de concesiones sobre terrenos para explotarlos, la construcción de torres para extraer petróleo y gas, así como ampliaciones de refinerías y almacenes, la venta de los productos a los mercados local y nacional, inversión en el mercado de inversiones, etc.
De cómo gestiones estas acciones dependerá la cantidad de inversiones (puntos de victoria) que consigas.
131241.name: Oilfield

131242.description:
2-4 player game, 15-20 minute game play. Players are the bosses of their families in the 1930's gangster era. Players hire thugs, bookies and torpedos to help them gain control of the various rackets in the city. Card play weakens/enhances family strengths duing the game. The major twist is the HIT die, played during a racket round, where every character is a target!

Mature themes (nothing you couldn't read about in any Time-Life book from the library), recommended for 12+ years.

From the designer of Battle of the bands, Backstage Pass and Portable Adventures card games.

Players (families) battle each other to control a set number of rackets, 2 of one kind of racket or 3 of any kind racket. You build your family using thug, bookie and torpedo cards, collectively known as mug cards. They're point value is your power during rackets. When a racket card is being fought over, the players all roll a HIT die (1d6),any opponent mugs in play that match your die roll (a die is printed on the mug cards), those cards are eithered flipped-unusable during this round, or discarded. The die roll is then added to the remaining value of your mugs in play, highest score wins the contract. But, you must have a mug who can control that racket, otherwise it is discarded. Family cards are played during non racket rounds to help your family or hinder the opposition.
131242.name: King of Crime card game

131243.name: Bolonki
131243.description:
The objective of the game is: all the tokens of one player have to reach the opposite side of the board, the first player to do this, wins.
Each player takes 6 tokens of the same color and places them face down on one of the four sides of the board.
In each turn, the player moves a token to any of the neighboring cells that are not occupied; you can also jump a token on any other, only if the following cell is empty.
As all tokens back are the same, the player will have to remember which ones are his tokens and which those of their adversaries.
When a token reaches the opposite side of the board, the player has to check if that token is of his color.
If is of his color, the token is put it off the board waiting for the other 5 tokens until the 6 ones reach their destination.
If is not of his color, the token has to return to the cell where it started the move.
When the 6 tokens of one of the players reaches the opposite side of the board the game ends.

131244.name: Conclave
131244.description:
Conclave® is a cooperative browser-based RPG that captures the spirit of tabletop gaming with friends.


Play with your friends. And we mean play - not just send each other gifts! Work together to defeat foes in combat and determine the course of the story.
Play at your own pace. Play in realtime, or take a turn anytime it's convenient: at lunch, during a break, whenever.
Play on any browser. Are you online? Good: you're playing Conclave. Desktop, laptop, iPhone, iPad, Android, and so on. Nothing to download either.


Cooperative Tactical Combat

Fight alongside your friends on the field of battle as you work together to reverse the Age of Retreat. Plan your tactics and bring your character's unique martial and magical abilities to bear. Persevere in your quests, and the Conclave may yet endure.




Party Decisions

Face critical decisions and trials as you adventure. Your characters' skills and traits determine the choices available to you; it's then up to your party to vote on a course of action, for good or for ill.




Synchronous and Asynchronous Play

Combat, voting, and chat update in realtime when you're online so that you can see other players' actions and their effects on the game. But you don't have to stay online: Conclave will notify you when there's new action to see.




Unique Characters

Create characters from an original set of races and archetypes. Customize your characters' skills and abilities as you level up. Increase your Renown to unlock more equipment options in the Vault of Arms.




Adventure in an Epic Fantasy World

Choose from a variety of quests that reveal themselves as you adventure. You determine the course of your party's story - and the fate of the lands of the Conclave.




Source: The Game Website.

131246.description:
After the release of Siberia from Reiner Stockhausen and dlp games in 2011, the search for resources – gas, charcoal, petroleum, diamonds and gold – in the wilderness of Siberia continues in Siberia: The Card Game with players using investors, salesmen, and workers to extract the most profitable resources.

Eight resource cards start on the table, with the three leftmost face-up, and resources of the same type must be extracted from left to right. Each player starts with one worker cards on the table and five action cards in hand; an action card shows a combination of one of the five resources and one of the three workers. On a turn, the player first reveals one of the face-down resource cards, then chooses one of the following:


Passes on playing cards and draws two action cards. (A player can hold at most eight cards.)
Plays two action cards that bear the same symbol, takes the appropriate action (claim a character or extract resources), then draws one action card. (Any two action cards can be used as a joker, but you need at least one symbol of the appropriate type to take an action.)


What do the characters do? Each investor has a different resource symbol, and when you extract that resource in the future, you need to play only one card instead of two. The salesman either boosts the value of a particular resource or the value of a character type at the end of the game. The worker allows you extract more resources.

When you extract resources, you take one card from the resource row (starting at the left) for each worker you have in front of you, then replace those cards with face-down cards from the resource deck. When the last resource card is revealed, each player takes on final turn, then they tally their scores, scoring $1,000 for each character and the printed value for each resource card (unless a salesman modifies those values). The player with the highest total wins!

The five salesman cards in Siberia: The Card Game can be used as an expansion for Siberia, and rules for this expansion are included.

Expands (while also being a standalone game)


Siberia
131246.name: Siberia: The Card Game

131247.name: Heroes of Pinnacle City
131247.description:
From the Introduction:

The world teeters on the brink of disaster! Madmen with doomsday devices, countless alien races poised to invade, meddlesome time-travellers, interdimensional conquerors, vampires in government, and demons in coffee shops. The superpowered heroes of Pinnacle City are all that stands between the earth and total annihilation. Now if only they would do something about it instead of arguing with each other and hiding behind their secret identities.

Pinnacle City is the center of heroism, villainy, politics and catastrophe. Hardly a day passes without someone holding the city ransom or blowing up a large portion of it. Maybe you're a hero trying to have a normal life while keeping the world safe. Maybe you're an official trying to make those damned heroes get over their egos and petty squabbling and help, or to expose them for what they really are. Perhaps you're the villain with his finger on the button, poised to show the world what you're capable of. Or, just maybe, you're an ordinary citizen caught in the middle of it all.

131248.name: Trade Raiders
131248.description:
Operational level wargame for the battle of the Atlantic between 1939 to 1942. Standard game is covering commerce raiding by the capital ships and Armed Merchant Cruisers. U-boat and aircraft can add by using optional rules.

Players control either Kriegsmarine(German Navy) or Allied Navy.
The main part of the game is search and pursuit of opponent ships with dual maps and secret units deployment.

The purpose of German player is sinking of Allied convoy.
The purpose of Allied player is escort of convoy, and also sinking of the German warships.

131249.name: Pigpen
131249.description:
Put your overalls on and prepare for some family fun of the swine kind.

Pig-Pen is a quick fire family strategy game where each player does their best to capture pigs in pens. Grab your hand and play cards building your pen to capture the pigs. However, be careful, as your opponent will be looking to ruin your hard work and steal your pigs!

In a game of Pig-Pen, players are dealt a hand of five cards, with these cards they are going to build pens to capture pigs. A stack of Pigs, depending on the number of players, is the timer for the game. Once these pigs are gone the game is over. On their turn players replenish their hands back to five cards, then they are allowed to play two cards and finally they may discard any number of cards they choose. The choices they have are to either build their pen(s) or attack their opponent(s.) Pens are made six cards: Four Pen cards, a Feed card to entice the pig and finally a Gate card. Players can attack their opponents with attack cards that destroy Pen cards or Unlock Gates. Even when a Pig is captured, it still isn't safe as players can attempt to steal it with Attack cards. Players ultimate goal is to have the best point Pigs in their Pens at games end.

Pig-Pen also features three levels of play. A simple children's level, an intermediate level with some number comparisons. And the always fun Secret Bacon Pack, where no Pig is safe from destruction of the bacon kind.

131250.name: The Lost Dataslate
131250.description:
From the Introduction:

Hail all loyal Tech-Priests and other servants of the Machine Cult! Welcome to The Lost Dataslate, a compilation of additional material for The Lathe Worlds, the Dark Heresy supplement covering the Adeptus Mechanicus within the Calixis Sector. Here players and GMs can find new origins for their Mechanicum characters, a new NPC to guide them within the Lathes system, additional armoury weapons and gear, and revelations for one of the more mysterious of the Lathe Worlds. Fire the Forges with these new blessings of the Omnissiah!

131251.name: The Dark Kin
131251.description:
From the Introduction:

This web-exclusive supplement to The Soul Reaver provides new options for Dark Eldar Explorers that players and Game Masters alike can use alongside the Kabalite Warrior Career Path featured in the main volume to explore new facets of the insidious Dark Eldar. This supplement requires a copy of the Rogue Trader Core Rulebook for use.

These new options include the Wych Career Path, for players who wish to take on the role of these elegant and brutal killers. Unlike Kabalite Warriors, who focus on inflicting suffering at range, Wyches are artists of the arena, melee combat specialists who do their dark work up close. To them, a dying breath is not a whisper heard from afar, but a billowing breeze that stirs around them each time they kill.

Further, it contains three Alternate Career Ranks to help players construct iconic Dark Eldar characters. The Skyterror is a master of aerial combat, the fiendish Fleshcrafter Disciple twists bodies into terrifying new forms, and the Incubus Initiate relentlessly pursues martial perfection. With these deadly tools in hand, we hope that players will go on to create unique Dark Eldar characters to overcome deadly challenges, reap vast and terrible rewards, and shake the Koronus Expanse to its very core.

131252.name: Croc Poissons
131252.description: The die is rolled and each player must "catch" the small fish with the color designated by the dice. But beware, if the fish bite black fish by mistake, the player must put all catched fish back into play. When there are no more fish on the table, except the black one the game ends and the player with the most fish in his pile is the winner.

131253.name: Ni Oui Ni Non: edition Premium
131253.description:
An expansion of the classic Nicht Ja, Nicht Nein with a case of 55 additional cards included in the box.

Object of the game is during the questions try other players
to answer forbidden words YES or NO. If somebody answer so
others must then quickly ring the bell to move their pawn on the gameboard if they are the quickest.

The winner is who gets there first with his character in the middle of the board.

131255.name: HK TPK
131255.description:
publisher blurb

Hong Kong, June 1997: Over 150 years of British rule is drawing to a close, and everybody is scrambling to make their mark before the handover. The Crown Colony is a pressure-cooker of energy and uncertainty, and nobody is sure who is going to come out on top—it’s the world’s most exclusive night club, an hour before closing. With guns. Lots of guns.

From the triad gangsters to the cops to the big-business taipans, the players are in motion and everybody has got something in the pot. Old man Liang is packing up and heading to Canada. Helen Chu’s brother works for the government, and he says the PRC is going to lock everything down. Jimmy Wong says he’s going nowhere because where there’s uncertainty, there’s money to be made. As the old saying goes, when the winds of change blow, some build walls and others build windmills.

This playset was written by Corey Reid, John Rogers, and Gareth-Michael Skarka.

131256.name: The Gnomes of Hawthorn Hall
131256.description:
The hardworking gnomes at Hawthorn Hall have decided to plant a lovely new garden, but they only have three days to do it! Lead your team of gnomes in planting new beds of roses, laying new lawns, digging new ponds, and planting five new hawthorn trees. On the third day, when the last tree is planted, the gnomes will be will able to rest, but only the most successful gardener will win.

The Gnomes of Hawthorn Hall is a family tile-laying game in which the players compete to build and claim new areas of roses, lawns and ponds. In each turn players can play cards to claim a tile, add it to the layout to grow the garden, and then optionally play another card to move one of their gnomes onto the tile to claim an area. The novel card play combines with simple tile-laying rules to create a fast, colourful game that looks polite — but can often be anything but!

At the end of the game, players score points for all the garden areas that contain their gnomes. The rose-beds are worth 1 points per plot; the ponds 2 points; lawns are worth a number points equal to their width multiplied by their height. In addition the five hawthorn tress add 1 bonus point to each adjacent garden area. The player with the most points is the winner.

131258.name: CONTACT:  Das Taktische UFO-Rollenspiel (Grundregelwerk)
131258.description:
Core book.
Publisher blurb:

Wir schreiben das Jahr 2047
Unsere Technologie hat sich weiterentwickelt. Der Krieg hat sich weiterentwickelt.
Die menschliche Rasse hat es nicht getan.

Nicht schlauer als Höhlenmenschen sind wir im Angesicht der fremden Bedrohung, die unsere Welt schon Jahrtausende lang beobachtet hat - verborgen, stets auf der Lauer und voller Argwohn.

Jetzt hat der Feind genug gewartet.

Er steigt herab auf eine Welt, die vom Krieg zerrüttet, uneins und schwach ist, bereit, ihrer Zivilisation den Todesstoß zu versetzen.

CONTACT

- Das Taktische UFO-Rollenspiel -

In diesem Science-Fiction-Rollenspiel geht es um eine Welt, die von unbekannten Mächten be-droht wird. In den Rollen von Mitgliedern der internationalen paramilitärischen UFO-Abwehrorganisation OMEGA werden die Spieler all ihr Können und ihren Verstand einsetzen müssen, um sich nicht nur gegen die Aliens, sondern auch heimische Gegenspieler zu beweisen. Denn dies ist eine Welt, in der menschlicher Irrsinn und Machtgier genau so gefährlich sein können wie der unheilvolle Schrecken aus dem Weltraum.

Die Rede ist natürlich von der Erde - so, wie sie im Jahr 2047 wirklich aussehen könnte.

Betrete ein fesselndes Setting voller Geheimnisse und High-Tech mit einem Rollenspielsystem, das spannende Geschichten, Charakterrollenspiel und ansprechende Regeln mit Strategieaspekten in sich vereint.

Google translation

It's the year 2047
Our technology has evolved. The war has evolved.
The human race has not done it.

Not smarter than cavemen we are in the face of foreign threats, to monitor our world for millennia long - hidden, always on the alert and full of suspicion.

Now the enemy has waited enough.

He descends on a world devastated by war, is divided and weak, ready to put their civilization the deathblow.

CONTACT

- The UFO Tactical role-playing game -

In this sci-fi role-playing game is about a world of unknown forces is under threat. In the roles of members of the international paramilitary organization UFO Defense OMEGA, players will have to use all their skill and wits to come to prove not only against the aliens, but also domestic counterparts. For this is a world in which human folly and greed for power can be just as dangerous as the sinister horrors from outer space.

The question is naturally the earth - as they could in 2047 really look like.

Enter a captivating setting of mystery and high-tech with an RPG system that combines exciting stories, role-playing and character appealing rules with policy aspects in itself.

131259.name: Zug um Zug
131259.description:
Publisher blurb:

Der Atomzug Tango-3 befördert heiße Fracht: OMEGA ist es in Südeuropa gelungen, eine Gruppe Aliens aus der Fraktion der Plünderer lebend gefangen zu nehmen. An Bord von Spezialwagons mit Wachen, Wissenschaftlern und Quarantänevorkehrungen sollen die Aliens samt den Wrackteilen ihres Schiffes zum europäischen Hauptquartier in Deutschland gebracht werden, um weiteren Untersuchungen unterzogen werden zu können. Doch plötzlich bricht der Kontakt zum Gefangenentransport ab. Die Lage ist unklar, eine Gefährdung von Zivilisten ist nicht ausgeschlossen - es gibt keine Zeit zu verlieren. Euer Truppentransporter steht bereit. Schnappt euch eure Ausrüstung und steigt ein, denn ihr habt einen Auftrag ...

ZUG UM ZUG ist ein explosives CONTACT-Abenteuer für 3-6 Spieler, bei dem die Charaktere es mit gefährlichen Aliens, irren UFO-Kultisten und einem außer Kontrolle geratenen Nuklearreaktor auf Schienen zu tun bekommen. Doppelgleiszüge sind die größten und schwersten Landfahrzeuge der Welt, und wenn sie einmal Fahrt aufgenommen haben, gibt es nur wenig, was sie aufhalten kann. Und als ob das nicht genug wäre, sind die Rollen der Jäger und Gejagten auf dem dahinrasenden Ungetüm keineswegs klar vergeben. Eine tödliche Hatz beginnt!

Google translation

The Atomzug Tango-3 transported hot to handle: OMEGA has succeeded in Southern Europe to capture a group of aliens from the group of looters alive. On board of special wagons with guards, scientists and quarantine measures are the aliens are brought together with the wreckage of their ship to the European headquarters in Germany, to be subjected to further investigations. But suddenly breaks off contact with the prisoner transport. The situation is not clear danger to civilians is not impossible - there is no time to lose. Your troop ship is ready. Grab your gear and gets in, because you have a job ...

TICKET TO RIDE CONTACT is an explosive adventure for 3-6 players, in which the characters get there with dangerous aliens mistaken UFO cultists and a runaway nuclear reactor to do on rails. Double track trains are the largest and heaviest land vehicle in the world, and once they have picked up speed, there is little that can stop what they are. And as if that were not enough, the roles of hunter and hunted on the speeding monster are not clearly assigned. A deadly chase begins!

131260.description:
Qwixx is a quick-playing dice game in which everyone participates, no matter whose turn it is. Each player has a scoresheet with the numbers 2-12 in rows of red and yellow and the numbers 12-2 in rows of green and blue. To score points you want to mark off as many numbers as possible, but you can mark off a number only if it's to the right of all marked-off numbers in the same row.

On a turn, the active player rolls six dice: two white and one of each of the four colors listed above. Each player can choose to mark off the sum of the two white dice on one of their four rows, then the active player can choose to mark off the sum of one colored die and one white die in the row that's the same color as the die. The more marks you can make in a row, the higher your score for that row. Fail to cross off a number when you're the active player, however, and you must mark one of four penalty boxes on your scoresheet. If you mark off the 2 or 12 in a row and have at least five numbers marked in that row, you get to also mark off the padlock symbol in that row, locking everyone else out of this color.

When either a player has four penalty boxes marked or a second color is locked, the game ends immediately. Players then tally their points for each color, sum these values, then subtract five points for each marked penalty box. Whoever has the highest score wins.

German second edition with SdJ 2013 nominee mark

131261.name: RISK: StarCraft Collector's Edition
boardgamepublisher: Winning Moves Germany (Winning Moves Deutschland GmbH)
131261.description:
From the website:

WHO WANTS SOME?!

The Koprulu Sector is being ravaged by war. You must stand against your enemies as one of the three powerful races. Will you choose the advanced and mysterious Protoss, the rugged and tenacious Terran, or lead the ravenous Zerg swarm? No matter which race you choose, you will fight for your very survival. The war for galactic supremacy begins NOW!

In this version of Risk, players are controlling the three factions from the StarCraft video game, in a battle to control the sector. The players recruit and mobilize their units in order to gain control of the various areas on the board. Battle is resolved using dice as in regular Risk, but also with special power cards which are given to players who control certain areas on the board. As in traditional Risk, players move troops and attack into territories on the board, and face off with opponents in dice battles where higher rolls eliminate opposing forces, with tied rolls favoring the defending troops.

Includes 4 ways to play:

Basic Training (3-6 players) : the players start on a pre-set map and strive to collect three achievements (controlling certain areas, conquering 10 territories in one turn, etc').
Command Room (3-6 players) : similar to Basic Training, but the players get to set up the map (e.g. placing mineral fields which make certain territories be worth more than others) and place their starting units by themselves.
Total Domination (2-6 players) : Closest to the original Risk. The players play until one player controls the entire map.
Team Play (4 or 6 players) : Variant of "Command Room" for playing 2v2 or 3v3.

131262.name: Werewolf Country
131262.description:
From the book:

Scenario for character levels 3-6. Adventurers are pressured into tackling disturbances in an outlying village of the realm. A band of raiders hiding up in a disused tomb, robbers hiding in the forests, a secret cult dispensing local justice, and a local Nazi party, are quite a challange. A two-round tournament scenario concentrating on role-playing ability. Rules and 8 pregenerated characters are provided.

131263.name: The Banking Game
131263.description:
This is a financial game about saving money and becoming a millionaire. The object of the game is to own a $200K home, a $50K auto, a $300 business, 100K in stocks, $200K in bonds, 100K in gold or collectibles, and $100K in savings.

Players move along a pathway after twirling a special spinner that results in percentage increases in a designated form of investment or requires the player to draw an event card. There is score card that spells R-E-T-I-R-E-D as the player reaches each financial goal. Event cards reward a player who follows up on a hot "tip" and puts his or her cash into that form of investment on the following turn.

The first player to spell RETIRE on the score card is declared the winner.

Includes the colorful board with a built-in spinner, tokens, play money, cards, score sheets, rules, storage insert, booklet about banking, and a cassette tape with a seminar about the banking industry.

131264.name: Freeze Tag
131264.description:
Pyramids race to the other side, trying not to get frozen along the way.

Freeze Tag is a Looney Pyramids game that uses the pyramids and a die from IceDice along with a 5x5 board. Each turn, a player rolls the pyramid die and moves the piece(s) shown on the die. They can land on larger pieces to freeze them or smaller pieces to teleport them. The first person to cross the board with three pieces wins.

131265.name: Satellites
131265.description: Each player starts with 16 numbered tiles (two each of numbers 1 through 8) and take turns playing one of them. The number on the tile dictates how many spaces the player moves around the board, and an arrow on the space where the player ends his turn indicates the row or column where that tile must be placed. This row or column is then scored based on the tiles present in it. Red and blue tiles belong to each player; yellow tiles placed in the center can be scored by either player provided the row or column including them contains more points in his color than his opponent. Once a row or column is scored, it cannot be scored again for the rest of the game. Highest score after all possible tiles have been played wins.

131266.name: Beyond the Great Wall
131266.description:
From the Back of the Book:
Will you survive your journey beyond the great wall?

It's the year 1901, and Baron von Frothingham, an eccentric collector of art, has contacted you for an important mission. He wants you to find his agent who disappeared near the Great Wall while searching for treasures. If you can find the agent, the baron will reward you handsomely. But eight other fortune hunters seek the same prize, so you must choose the quickest and safest route. What should you do?

131267.name: Longhorn Territory
131267.description:
From the Back of the Book:
There's no place for cowards in the old west!

It's 1860. You've just taken the stagecoach out west to visit your uncle, the sheriff of San Talpa. Before the day is out, he asks you to become his deputy--that is, unless you'd rather join the Pony Express instead! Which should you choose?

131268.name: The First Olympics
131268.description:
From the Back of the Book:
You are a contestant in the first Olympics!

You and your cousin Felix are touring Olympic ruins in Greece when you wander into a dark cave. Suddenly you find yourself caught up in a procession of athletes that passes ivory-white temples along the road. You've travelled back in time to the ancient Olympic games! The contests are about to begin, and now you're a competitor. Will you sign up to compete in the wrestling event, or test your skills as a chariot driver?

131269.name: Mystery of the Sacred Stones
131269.description:
From the Back of the Book:
Can you unlock the deadly secret of the Sacred Stones?

A trip to Florida seems like a great way to spend a summer vacation, until you find one of the mysterious Calusa Gull Stones. According to an ancient Indian legend, the stone has a mate, and if the two are paired, a terrible power will be unleashed. You're determine to find the stone's mate--and destroy them both--before a deadly time-traveling spirit can use their power. But will you be able to locate the other sacred stone and stop this ancient evil before it's too late?

131270.name: The Perfect Planet
131270.description:
From the Back of the Book:
What is not so perfect on the perfect planet?

While on a routine scouting mission in your spaceship, you receive orders to investigate Utopa, the most perfect planet in the universe. Starvation and outbreaks of fighting have recently overrun Utopa, and now it's your job to save it from complete destruction. Will you investigate Utopa by orbiting in your spaceship, or will you land and set out on foot?

131271.name: Pickle
131271.description:
Pickle is an elimination style card game for 2-18 players. A game consists of repeating "hands". A hand consists of "tricks" which may range from a single card up to four card sets from each player. The object is not to end with the highest card. Players are eliminated when they acquire 36 points or if they run out of chips.

The custom The Pickle deck features 16 characters that help players learn the game by hinting at the strength of the card as well as unique play options.

131272.name: High Command
131272.description:
Military strategy game was published in 1942 during the middle of WWII.

The red army and the blue army face each other on a terrain grid which features rivers, mountains, forests, and cities. Each army includes 1 headquarters unit, 8 infantry units, and 6 tank units. The illustrated playing pieces are stand-up tokens similar to the kind used in Stratego.

Includes a colorful board, tokens, rules, and a storage insert.

131273.name: Return of the Ninja
131273.description:
From the Back of the Book

Can you settle an ancient family feud?

Your friend Nada teaches martial arts at a school called a dojo in the mountains of Japan. When she goes away to take care of some family business, she leaves you in charge. But when Nada does not return, you must decide whether to get involved in a ninja family feud that could whirl you back a thousand years into the past.


User Notes

The 1989 English Soft Cover lacks About the Author and About the Illustrator back matter, which is unusual for the series during that printing run.

131274.name: Magic Master
131274.description:
From the Back of the Book:
Will you discover the amazing secrets of the Magic Master?

You've been a longtime fan of the Magic Master, whose spellbinding feats of magic have astounded audiences the world over. When the famous magician not only comes to your hometown to perform but actually moves there, you decide to visit his house, hoping to discover the secret of his powers. When you arrive there's no one home, but the door is unlocked. You are tempted to go inside and take a look around. What will you do?

131275.name: Torpedo Attack
131275.description:
Naval combat dexterity game was published in 1940.

Two plastic and metal ships are involved with the battle. A submarine fires an aluminum torpedo at a battleship. If the torpedo strikes the proper target zone on the battleship the vessel "explodes" and falls apart... the game mechanic is similar to the 1980s Milton Bradley classic Torpedo Run.

Includes the ships, the torpedo, and the rules. More experienced captains can take longer shots or otherwise embellish the game, but the concept was quite simple.

131276.name: Haunted Harbor
131276.description:
From the Back of the Book:
You're about to meet a ghost!

You're off on a sailing ship with your two best friends. One day you sail to a place called English Harbor and meet some island kids. They tell you that a ghost is haunting the nearby cemetery. You laugh and say you don't believe in ghosts. So your friends dare you to visit the cemetery at night--alone!

131277.name: The Fallcon Convention Card Game
131277.description:
(From the back of the box)
This game is a celebration of FallCon.

In this light filler game, you get to collect Personality Cards worth varying victory points.

Roll the dice and match up the numbers.

If you get lucky and roll the FallCon logo, your task just got easier as you can cover any number with that logo.

Keep rolling the dice if you feel lucky.

But if you can't match up a number with the dice rolled then you lose everything you collected during your turn.

Of course, like any good game, there is an opportunity to steal Personality Cards from other players.

You attended the Convention, now play the game and see all your favourite FallCon personalities come to life in your home.

131278.name: Batman: The Doomsday Prophecy
131278.description:
From the Back of the Book:
Batman's fate depends on you!

He's up against the craftiest criminals that ever tried to foil a crimefighter. The Joker wants to shrink him down to mouse-size. Two-Face has a clever plot to uncover his secret identity, and The Riddler wants nothing less than the end of Batman forever! But you can help Batman outwit his arch-enemies. You're in charge of the Caped Crusader's every move. But if you accidentally put him in dire danger, don't despair! You can always go back and choose another path... one that'll put the villains behind bars, and send Batman off on another thrilling adventure!

131279.name: Yamunda
131279.description: In Yamunda, players are expedition members who are searching for unusual creatures – and now they've discovered an incredibly bewildering variety of life around the Yamunda, a small river region in the Amazon. Whoever collects the most objects by the end of this journey will be the most successful expedition member and the winner of this game.

131280.name: Jolies Sirènes
131280.description:
You hold in your hands a magic mirror which reflects the girl will turn into a beautiful mermaid!
Just turn the arrow on the wheel to win one at a piece of the puzzle that make up the body of your siren (hair,
face, chest, tail ...) and put them on the mirror in the correct order.
But beware of the evil sea witch: she may resume at any time parts of the mirror!
The first player who has transformed the girl to mermaid in her mirror win the game!

131281.name: Aristoocrazy
131281.description:
Aristoocrazy is a game about the Middle Ages which deals not with the clichés of that period – such as religious fanaticism or cruelty – but rather with slightly exaggerated relationships within the noble families. It offers deep strategic choices, but spices them with fun, humor, and player communication. Relive this comedy about the Middle Ages and have fun with Aristoocrazy!

Each player has ten unique characters from his family at his disposal – five noblemen and five noblewomen – but he starts with only one pair of aristrocrats. Throughout the game, characters will struggle to conquer neutral regions or those controlled by an opponent, in addition to using the benefits of their abilities. Each character has three abilities, which are helpful for gaining victory points (VPs) or attacking other characters. The game has nine different abilities, which are represented by cardboard tokens. When a male and female character marry, new characters are born into play, with the newborn children inheriting its parents' abilities.

If two characters with a close family relationship meet, however, there is a risk that their child will be "different". When such a child grows up, naturally you'll need him to take care of your domain or a military campaign that you're running – but if his wits aren't in the right place, he won't be of much help. (And who would want to marry such a dud in the first place?)

Aristoocrazy lasts twelve rounds, and at the end of each round the victory conditions for the current round are evaluated. The players try to optimize their actions – moves on the board, attacks, the use of abilities – in order to fulfill the victory conditions defined on the event card in place for that round. The players who best fulfill the victory conditions are rewarded with VPs or special action cards, which can help them in certain situations in future rounds. The player with the most VPs after the final round wins!

131282.description:
Professor Pugnacious, full title Professor Pugnacious' Portfolio of Perils, Pugilism, and Perfidy: The Card Game of Victorian Combat is a fast-paced, tactical, deck-building game in which players take on the roles of rival proteges of Professor Pugnacious, building their decks to defeat adversaries and foil each other in a highly thematic game of Steampunk adventurers combating Gothic horrors.

Each player has access to only a portion of the pool of cards that can be purchased, which changes each turn and can be affected by played cards. Players attempt to gain enough Fight to defeat Enemies, as well as Failure to cause their rival players to lose their combats, and Skill to acquire more cards and disable traps. The game ends with the defeat of the Finale, a difficult and rewarding opponent.
131282.name: Professor Pugnacious
boardgameexpansion: Professor Pugnacious: Armies of the Undead

131283.name: Le Cochon Qui Rit Encore Plus
131283.description:
Modernized version of the classic game of The Laughing Pig

The pigs are dressed in funny outfits and accessories, becoming a bimbo, a football fan, a player lasso or a rocker.

The die has been replaced by a electric mechanism with the pig character sounds and voices.

The object is get his/her pig ready first spinning the wheel and fitting the pig together. But players must be careful and avoid the butcher!

131284.name: Mon Premier Cochon Qui Rit
131284.description:
My First The Laughing Pig for the littles ones. Recognize shapes. 2 levels of play for two years and olders.

Roll the dice and construct the pig. First player who gets his pig ready is the winner.

131285.name: Contact: Senkrechtstarter!
131285.description:
Quickstart rules for Contact

Publisher blurb:
Die Erdfunkstelle Fuchsstadt meldet sich nicht!

Der Senkrechtstarter ist ein 20-seitiges Heft, das gekürzte Kernregeln von Contact Kore mit einem vorgefertigten Kurzabenteuer von Frank Sauer verbindet. Mit ihm können Spielgruppen in der Welt von Contact ohne umfangreiche Vorbereitungen durchstarten, um mehrere Stunden lang Spaß zu haben.

Vorgefertigte Charaktere für bis zu fünf Spieler sind ebenfalls enthalten.

User translation:
Radio station Fuchsstadt doesn't answer!

Senkrechtstarter (= high flyer, vertical take-off) is a booklet of 20 pages providing you with reduced rules of Contact Kore and a short scenario by Frank Sauer. With it, a group of players can hit the ground running without lengthy preparations and have several hours of fun in the world of Contact.

Includes pregenerated characters for up to five players.

131287.description:
After one hundred years in service, the Panama Canal still is one of the most important and impressive engineering achievements in modern times.

Built in 1914, it held a prominent role in the deployment of military vessels during WWI and in the conflicts that have followed. Nowadays commercial usage is the core business of the Canal; its economic impact is profound and has not only developed the region, but in fact helped define shipping throughout the world.

In the wake of the Canal’s opening hull designs were influenced accordingly; ships fell into three categories, those that could travel through easily and in groups (Feeder class), massive ocean-going ships too big to enter the Canal (ULCV or Ultra Large Container Vessels), and the new standard—designed to the maximum limits of the Panama Canal. These ships are called PANAMAX.

In Panamax each player manages a shipping company established in the Colón Free Trade Zone. Companies accept contracts from both US coasts, China and Europe and deliver cargo in order to make money, attract investment and pay dividends. At the same time the players accumulate their own stock investments and try to make as much money as possible in an effort to have the largest personal fortune and win the game.

Panamax features several original mechanisms that blend together; an original dice (action) selection table, pickup-and-deliver along a single bi-directional route, a chain reaction movement system—“pushing” ships to make room throughout the Canal and a level of player interaction that is part self-interest, part mutual advantage and the freedom to choose how you play.

On their turn, players remove a die from the Action table to select Contracts and Load Cargo or Move ships until the pool of dice is emptied ending the Round. Over the course of three rounds these actions are blended during the turn to create a logistics network which the players use to ship their cargo, minimize transportation fees and increase the net worth of their Companies. Each Company has a limited amount of Stock that the players can purchase in exchange for investing—receiving a dividend each round. The questions for the players will be which companies are likely to yield higher dividends?

There’s more to explore and several ways to win, but we ask that you join us at the table and celebrate the 100th Anniversary of the Panama Canal with a session of Panamax!
